content.description:
# Rocklands

Rocklands is a popular bouldering destination in South Africa. It is located about 250km from Cape Town, on the edge of the Cederberg Mountains.

The area is known for its abundance of bright-orange sandstone boulders. Boulderers have frequented Rocklands since 1996, when Todd Skinner, Fred Nicole, and others began documenting bouldering routes in the area.

## Access

No climbing is allowed in Rocklands without a valid climbing permit. Land owners and Cape Nature rangers often conduct inspections in the climbing areas and anyone found without a permit will be asked to leave the climbing area. Permits can be obtained online - [Quicket](https://www.quicket.co.za/events/4582-rocklands-bouldering-permit/#/) - or purchased at [CapeNature's Kliphuis campsite office](https://www.capenature.co.za/accommodation/kliphuis-camping), [De Pakhuys campsite office](https://www.depakhuys.com), or [Traveller's Rest](https://www.travellersrest.co.za/)
